marketNews.title: APBN 5M25: Defisit 0.1%, Belanja Mulai Meningkat
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance again held a briefing regarding the realization of the 2025 State Budget (APBN) on Tuesday (17/6). Here are some important points from the briefing: State Revenue Declined Driven by Weakening Tax Receipts State revenue during 5M25 decreased by -11.4% YoY, reaching only 33% of the 2025 APBN target (vs. 5M24: 40%). This decline was mainly caused by weakening tax receipts of -10.1% YoY. Deputy Minister of Finance, Anggito Abimanyu, attributed the decline in tax revenue to restitution factors, considering that gross tax revenue still tends to be flat on an annual basis. For information, at the end of May 2025, the government appointed Bimo Wijayanto as the new Director General of Taxes. State Expenditures Started to Increase in May 2025 Meanwhile, state expenditures during 5M25 also dropped by about -11% YoY and only reached 28% of the 2025 APBN target (vs. 5M24: 34%). This decline occurred amidst efficiency initiatives that President Prabowo Subianto started ordering since January 2025. Nevertheless, Deputy Minister of Finance, Suahasil Nazara, said that state expenditures surged in May 2025 along with the identification of program reallocation in the APBN. In the next 2 months, state expenditures will also be boosted by an economic stimulus of approximately 24 trillion rupiah in June-July 2025. The realization of government revenue and expenditures during 5M25 resulted in a deficit of 21 trillion rupiah or equivalent to 0.09% of GDP, still far below the 2025 target of 2.53% of GDP. Sweetened Beverage Excise (MBDK) Postponed for Implementation This Year On the same occasion, Director General of Customs and Excise, Djaka Budi Utama, said that the excise on packaged sweetened beverages (MBDK) will not be implemented this year, although it might still be implemented in the future. Djaka did not elaborate on the reason behind the postponement. Previously, at the beginning of 2025, the Director of Communication and User Services Guidance for Customs and Excise, Nirwala Dwi Heryanto, stated that the government planned to implement MBDK excise in 2H25. The government targets MBDK excise revenue of 3.8 trillion rupiah in the 2025 APBN. Key Takeaway We assess that the trend of accelerating state expenditures is one of the key factors to support economic growth in 2H25, especially amidst increasing global uncertainty from US trade policies and geopolitical tensions. Low state expenditure itself is one factor behind weak economic growth in 1Q25. Meanwhile, the re-postponement of MBDK excise implementation has the potential to provide temporary relief for several issuers, namely MYOR, SIDO, ULTJ, CMRY and ICBP.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Denies Discussion of Cooperation Plan with Danantara
tickerNews.content: 1. TOBA: SVP Corporate Communications TBS Energi Utama, Ratri Wuryandari, told Kontan that until now TOBA has no discussion or cooperation plan with BPI Danantara. Ratri's statement emerged after TOBA was rumored to be one of the new and renewable energy sector issuers that would receive investment from Danantara.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group LABA Acquires 65% Stake in PT Aceh Mineral Abadi for Strategic Resources Security
tickerNews.content: 2. LABA: Green Power Group announced it has acquired 65% of the shares of PT Aceh Mineral Abadi for an undisclosed amount. PT Aceh Mineral Abadi is currently in the process of applying for copper and gold mine exploration permits covering an area of 2,522 hectares. LABA stated that this acquisition is aimed at securing strategic upstream resources in the supply chain for electric vehicle battery raw materials. LABA also explained that the company is actively communicating with Chinese companies - including China Nonferrous Metal Mining, Jiangxi Copper, and Huayou Cobalt - to discuss cooperation opportunities in the development of this project.

tickerNews.title: Summarecon Agung SMRA Establishes 2 Joint Ventures for Land Acquisition Valued at ~3.7 Trillion Rupiah for New Development
tickerNews.content: 3. SMRA: Summarecon Agung, through its subsidiary, PT Serpong Cipta Kreasi, established 2 joint ventures named PT Serpong Cahaya Harmoni and PT Serpong Cipta Lestari to acquire a total land area of approximately 121.7 hectares valued at approximately 3.7 trillion rupiah. This transaction indicates a land value of 3 million rupiah per square meter. The land was purchased from affiliated parties, namely PT Variatata and PT Lestari Kreasi, where both entities are also partners in the establishment of the joint venture. PT Serpong Cipta Kreasi itself holds a 60% ownership stake in PT Serpong Cahaya Harmoni and PT Serpong Cipta Lestari. This transaction is intended for the development of a new project in the Summarecon Serpong area.

tickerNews.title: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia ACES to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend Worth ~579.9 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: 4. ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia will distribute its 2024 book year dividend worth approximately 579.9 billion rupiah or 33.87 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 65% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 75%) and indicates a dividend yield of approximately 6.3% as of Wednesday (18/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 25, 2025, while payment is on July 17, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Transcoal Pacific TCPI Awarded Nickel Ore Transportation Contract Worth 183 Million USD Over 10 Years
tickerNews.content: 5. TCPI: Transcoal Pacific obtained a nickel ore transportation service contract worth 183 million US dollars from a non-affiliated nickel mining company in Southeast Sulawesi. The contract has a 10-year period, with an estimated transport volume of 100 million tons.

tickerNews.title: Trimegah Bangun Persada NCKL Shareholders Approve Dividend Distribution of ~1.9 Trillion Rupiah for 2024 Book Year
tickerNews.content: 6. NCKL: Investor Daily reported that the shareholders of Trimegah Bangun Persada approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to approximately 1.9 trillion rupiah or 30.33 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 30% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 30%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4.3% as of Wednesday (18/6). Cum date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: Hartadinata Abadi HRTA Subsidiary Prepares for LBMA Certification
tickerNews.content: 7. HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi announced that its precious metal refining subsidiary, PT Emas Murni Abadi, is currently preparing for London Bullion Market Association (LBMA) certification. As an initial preparation step, PT Emas Murni Abadi has received an independent assurance report with a reasonable assurance level regarding the audit conducted by Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Certified Public Accountants LLP. The report stated that the company's compliance report has been prepared fairly in all material respects, in accordance with the provisions stipulated in the LBMA Responsible Gold Guidance.

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi International MEDC Subsidiary Commences Commercial Operation of 25MWp Solar Power Plant in East Bali
tickerNews.content: 8. MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional, through its subsidiary, PT Medco Power Indonesia, has commenced commercial operation of a 25MWp solar power plant (PLTS) in Karangasem, East Bali. The project was developed through a cooperation between PT Medco Power Indonesia and Solar Philippines. The PLTS has signed a 20-year power purchase agreement with PLN. Over the next 2 decades, this facility will supply renewable energy to the local electricity grid and replace conventional energy sources. This PLTS can generate approximately 50 GWh of clean electricity per year, equivalent to the energy needs of about 42,000 households.

tickerNews.title: Medikaloka Hermina HEAL Controller and President Director Purchases ~2.5 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: 9. HEAL: The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, purchased approximately 2.5 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,386 rupiah per share on June 10-12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's ownership in HEAL increased from 4.7833% to 4.7996%.

tickerNews.title: Iran's Supreme Leader Warns of Serious Consequences Over Potential US Attacks Following Trump's Remarks
tickerNews.content: 1. The Supreme Leader of Iran, Ali Khamenei, stated on Wednesday (18/6) that Iran would not accept 'peace' and warned that any US attack in its territory would result in 'serious and irreversible consequences.' Khamenei's statement came after US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday (17/6) that Khamenei was an 'easy target' and that US patience was 'thinning out.'

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia Maintains BI Rate at 5.5% in June 2025 Meeting
tickerNews.content: 2. Bank Indonesia decided to maintain the BI Rate at 5.5% today, Wednesday (18/6), with the deposit facility and lending facility also maintained at 4.75% and 6.25%, respectively. This decision is in line with consensus expectations.

tickerNews.title: Bank Credit Growth Slowed to +8.43% YoY in 5M25, Lowest Since June 2023, Investment Credit Declined
tickerNews.content: 3. Bank Indonesia noted that banking credit growth slowed to +8.43% YoY in 5M25 (vs. 4M25: +8.88% YoY), marking the lowest growth rate since June 2023. Despite this, the result is in line with Bank Indonesia's revised target, which aims for banking credit growth in the range of +8-11% YoY throughout 2025. By use, investment credit during 5M25 grew by +13.74% YoY (vs. 4M25: +15.86% YoY), while consumption credit grew by +8.82% YoY (vs. 4M25: +8.97% YoY) and working capital grew by +4.94% YoY (vs. 4M25: +4.62% YoY). Meanwhile, Sharia financing in 5M25 grew by +9.19% YoY (vs. 4M25: +8.85% YoY) and MSME credit growth reached +2.17% YoY (vs. 4M25: +2.6% YoY).

tickerNews.title: KPK Summons Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor Filianingsih Hendarta as Witness in CSR Corruption Case
tickerNews.content: 4. The Chairman of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK), Setyo Budiyanto, told Bloomberg Technoz on Wednesday (18/6) that the KPK would summon Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor, Filianingsih Hendarta, as a witness in the alleged corruption case regarding the use of Bank Indonesia's corporate social responsibility funds for the 2022-2023 period. KPK expects Filianingsih to comply with the summons scheduled between June 17-19, 2025. Filianingsih and the Bank Indonesia spokesperson have not responded to requests for comment from Bloomberg.

tickerNews.title: Government Reviews Rules to Include Online Motorcycle Drivers in MSME Sector
tickerNews.content: 5. Minister of MSMEs, Maman Abdurrahman, said on Tuesday (17/6) that the government is reviewing new rules so that online motorcycle drivers can be included in the micro, small, and medium enterprise (MSME) sector, rather than being classified as formal workers. Maman stated that this policy will be included in the MSME Ministerial Regulation. Currently, the Ministry of MSMEs is in discussion with the Ministry of Transportation, the Ministry of Communication and Digital, and the Ministry of Manpower.

tickerNews.title: BPI Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani Prepares 130 Trillion Rupiah for 3 Million Home Program, Funded by State-Owned Banks and BSI
tickerNews.content: 6. BPI Danantara CEO, Rosan Roeslani, stated on Wednesday (18/6) that his party will disburse funds amounting to 130 trillion rupiah by the end of 2025 to support the government's program of 3 million homes per year. Rosan explained that the funds will come from the grouping of state-owned banks (Himbara) and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). Rosan also mentioned that the financing scheme for housing for this program is currently being finalized.

tickerNews.title: Temasek Holdings Welcomes Opportunity to Cooperate with Indonesian Wealth Fund Danantara
tickerNews.content: 7. Temasek Holdings Pte. told Bloomberg that they welcome the opportunity to cooperate with BPI Danantara. This comment followed President Prabowo Subianto saying that he looks forward to 'close collaboration' between the two companies.

tickerNews.title: KPPU Gives Conditional Approval for TikTok's Takeover of Tokopedia Shares
tickerNews.content: 8. The Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU) on Tuesday (17/6) gave conditional approval for the share acquisition transaction of PT Tokopedia by TikTok Nusantara (SG) Pte. Ltd. Previously, KPPU investigators found that the acquisition transaction of Tokopedia by TikTok had the potential to result in monopoly practices and/or unfair business competition. Conditional approval for this transaction was granted after Tokopedia and TikTok agreed to meet all requested requirements, including guarantees of open payment and logistics methods as well as measures to prohibit predatory pricing practices. Supervision of the implementation of these conditions will be carried out from the date of the determination until June 17, 2027.

tickerNews.title: SKK Migas Targets New Oil and Gas Projects to Onstream in 2026
tickerNews.content: 9. Expert staff to the Minister of EMR, Nanang Abdul Manaf, stated on Tuesday (17/6) that SKK Migas targets new oil and gas projects consisting of the Hidayah, Genting Oil, Geng North, and Andaman projects to start operating (onstream) in 2026.

tickerNews.title: Wilmar Group Surrenders 11.8 Trillion Rupiah Bail Money to Attorney General's Office Related to 2021-2022 CPO Export Corruption Case
tickerNews.content: 10. Wilmar Group (SI: WLIL) stated on Tuesday (17/6) that they have handed over money amounting to 11.8 trillion rupiah to the Attorney General's Office as bail money related to the alleged corruption case of CPO exports during the 2021-2022 period. Previously, the Central Jakarta District Court in March 2025 acquitted Wilmar Group and 2 other companies of the charges. However, the Attorney General's Office filed an appeal against the verdict and demanded a fine of 11.8 trillion rupiah from Wilmar Group. Wilmar Group told Tempo that the money will be returned if the Supreme Court upholds the verdict of the Central Jakarta District Court. On the other hand, if the Supreme Court rules that Wilmar Group is guilty, the money may be confiscated by the state entirely or partially.
